H0.text: Friction is the characteristic that determines the gravity of an object, given that gravity is a measurable force of attraction which acts upon objects.

H1.text: Mass determines the gravity of an object, since gravity is a measurable force of attraction that acts upon objects.

H2.text: Tension is the characteristic that determines the gravity of an object, a measurable force of attraction which acts upon objects.

H3.text: Weight is the characteristic that determines the gravity of an object, as gravity is a measurable force of attraction that acts upon objects.

A4.text: A body's mass also determines the degree to which it generates and is affected by a gravitational field.

A5.text: The object's mass also determines the strength of its gravitational attraction to other bodies.
